description: From Ancient Greek μυριάρχης (muriárkhēs) in Herodotus or μυρίαρχος (muríarkhos) in Xenophon, from μυρίος (muríos, “myriad, ten thousand”) + -άρχης (-árkhēs) or -αρχος (-arkhos, “-arch: ruler, commander”), calque of Old Iranian *baivar-pati-.
As a Mongolian commander, Calque of Mongolian tümen-ü noyon.

definitionGroups.group: A ruler or commander over 10,000 people, particularly

entries.meaning: (historical military) The commander of a Mongolian tomen.
(historical politics) The governor of a myriarchy in Mongolian Tibet.
